website_summaries.verdict: By far the most practical choice if you are looking for a low-cost set with lots of sockets – you'll love the variety, convenient case, and affordable price.
pros: This set tops our list for value considering all you get for the price – 40 pieces including a reversible ratchet and versatile sockets plus a tough, portable organizing case
cons: Slightly less durable than costlier models, but works well for most tasks for the typical consumer

customer_reviews.title: not a bad set for
customer_reviews.text: Broke the 3/8 to 1/4 converter the second day using it, but you get what you pay for, not a bad set for $20 Edit: EPAuto saw my review on here, and sent me a replacement for the part I broke without me even requesting it. Great service and a really excellent product, especially for under $20.
customer_reviews.author: thane schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Better than the usual "affordable" tools
customer_reviews.text: Good cheap option to have around the house. Not professional grade, but better than most "cheap" tools. Probably won't hold up long with heavy everyday use, but will be fine for occasional work around the house.
customer_reviews.author: fuzzydonut

customer_reviews.title: No complaints!!!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed, exactly what I ordered! Everything is well made. Who says you have to pay a fortune for good quality!!! 5*
customer_reviews.author: Old Retired Artist/Chef

customer_reviews.title: Good complete set
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if there's significant difference between the imperial and international sizes (I have honestly used them interchangeably without much issues). There's always one of each that somewhat fits the one I need. So I try to pick the one that feels a bit tighter. I also use it with my Bosch drill, without issues. The only inconvenient is that the little box doesn't seem to hold the pieces well, so normally I need to be really careful to open the box to avoid pieces flying everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Barrera

customer_reviews.title: Nevermind the case, it's loose but still good.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitated to order this set after negative feedback about the case, but actually the case turned out to be good if you just take care and open it the correct way, the first time I opened it, all the sockets fall out because it was flipped upside down! but actually I have another socket set that's really sticky and I don't like it for that specific reason, so just take care to lay it flat and everything will be good and stay in place, quality is good just finished my car brake job with it, can't complain about it with that price.
customer_reviews.author: Schwab

customer_reviews.title: Handy small socket set
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact set of small sockets. Walls look thin on sockets but hope they will hold up. Case and paddinfgseem to hold everything and keep them from rolling around. Markings are difficult to see but I went over them with a black felt tip. Then wipe the black off and it stayed in the marking....much better. Will be handy for small and lighter work. Naturally made in Taiwan like everything else (or China) but I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: George W. Norris

customer_reviews.title: this is perfect for me to use not everyday
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is perfect for me to use not everyday. It has the sizes I need for specific jobs in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Member

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for Harry Homeowner
customer_reviews.text: Cheap but does the job. I'm not a professional so I don't need a set that will stand up to constant use.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Pascoe

customer_reviews.title: Parts Don't FIT Well!
customer_reviews.text: This kit is fine...unless you want to separate the parts once you put them together! Putting the bits on the wrench ratchet is easy. Taking them off requires a hammer, a rag and a pair of pliers! I used these things on my first job today and taking the bits off the ratchet and the adapter was impossible. Also, seeing the part number is very difficult, even with a flashlight. But that would still be manageable if they actually fit on the ratchet. I HATE this product. Finding out it doesn't work on a job is very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Confederate

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be quite high quality tools, I bought then as a spare set to keep in the house. The sockets have a high gloss, very smooth chrome plating, and look like they're the "flank drive" design. The ratchet is well made, and very smooth and shiny. The mechanism has fine teeth, and isn't sloppy feeling. I only wish the set was available with a 1/4" drive ratchet instead of the 3/8" drive.
customer_reviews.author: USgov.Planned911

customer_reviews.title: As good as the big named tool kits
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a Christmas gift for my son-in-law. He loves them. I asked him what I should rate them and he said a 5. He said they are very sturdy and well made. Although he hasn't used them a lot at this point, when he has used them he has said they are like using some of the more named brand tools. I know when I purchased them they were a very well priced kit and from their description seemed to be just as good as the bigger named brand tools. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these primarily for one job - removing a hard to access bolt on my car. However, now I use them for almost every job around the house - I cant believe I was even using a regular wrench sometimes. Just yesterday I used them to take the nuts off my AC access panel. Today I used them to install a TV mount. And sure, there are probably much better ones out there, but if you're like me and only need them for the occasional job or two - you really can't find anything better for 20 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Arsalan Baig

customer_reviews.title: Basic homeowner socket set...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry. Easy to get to verses opening up my huge carry socket set. I use this for quick easy jobs and small repairs. 6 point is a little harder to use but very kind to the bolt heads. Less chance of stripping. Most all I have in sockets is 6 point. I was able to put a Stanley 1/4 drive ratchet and a couple 1/4 inch extensions in this set as an addition. Tight fit but the case still closes. This is a nice easy to get to socket set. You can't go wrong with this as a basic homeowner needing occasional hand tools for odd jobs around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Holiday

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these, save you money
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, these are junk. The so called reversible ratchet failed after just a few uses. You may choose this product because of the price, but do yourself a favor and spend the extra money, quality tools although expensive can last a lifetime, these however are not quality. Even if theses were free it would not be worth the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: For occasional use - this set is what you want
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a much more expensive socket set and really liked it, but it was lacking the smaller-sized sockets for which I had need for a couple of things around the house. This little kit was actually way more than I needed, but for the price, I felt i was getting a bargain. Since I've bought this one, I've used it a handful of times, using both the ratchet and the spinner handle. It worked as expected for all uses.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Guru

customer_reviews.title: My husband loved it. Great Value and quality
customer_reviews.text: A lot of my husband's tools were stolen and he needed a lot of missing sockets. I got this for him for his birthday and he loves it. He was going to go to Walmart to pick up a set but this came just in time so he could install his new battery in his car minus the trip. He said they worked wonderfully. It was a lot smaller than I imagined it would be but my husband says it has everything he needs.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny C.

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised at the quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a backyard project that required the use of several tools that a neighbor had borrowed and never returned before moving. I must admit I bought this set because of the price never expecting the quality of the toolset I received. The ratchet handle fits my hand better than the much more expensive set I had and is more comfortable to use for extended periods of time. No slipping on the ratchet either! The sockets are not the thin-walled cheap steel I was expecting either, but strong, sturdy and built to last. I expected a one project throw away and instead got a ratchet set I expect to use for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Karen DeCrane

customer_reviews.title: The ratcheting wrench itself is nice..
customer_reviews.text: For 20 bucks it hit my price point. . . ..I needed some tools for my camping/travel tool box and this set has all the basics. The ratcheting wrench itself is nice . .. . Full polished. . . Decent action. . . .The box itself feels like the tabs won't break off. . I'd buy it again for this price.
customer_reviews.author: American Made

customer_reviews.title: Great socket set
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set to buy for the price, all of my tools were stolen and I have to start overtime is a great start. The only down side i have is the sockets don’t pop into place when putting them back. They just rest in the respective sockets. However it has a foam pad on the lid that keeps everything in place when closing up. My advice don’t open upside down like I did lol. Great seller and fast shipping. Came faster than estimated time Thankyou!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good Value ratchet Set with metric and SAE socket sizes but....
customer_reviews.text: Why 4 stars for a set I like? Because the rachet set includes 1/4 and 3/8 socket drives sizes and while most of the sockets are sized for 1/4" drive, the rachet handle is sized for the larger3/8" size. Yes, an adapter is included but if most of your work is in the smaller range this the larger rachet size becomes an unnecessary inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: ValueBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Just added to my "junk tool" collection
customer_reviews.text: I should have known better from past experience. At this price point, all you can expect is junk. When it comes to hand tools, go for an established name brand with a good reputation. Close the case on this set, and all the smaller sockets fall out of their cutouts. Socket wrench felt flimsy as well. I'm hesitant to use, so I'll just throw into the back of my truck for a spare, and order a good set. I should have known better . . . Yup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for occasional use or as a back-up set
customer_reviews.text: There are alot of sizes, and a small case, so it's useful for me to keep in my truck for surprises that come up. No deep sockets at all, so don't consider this product if you need those. The items dont snap into the case. They only rest in the indentations, so if you bump your case while it's open they go everywhere. For the price and size, it's great for someone that needs them for occasional home use or a back-up set to keep in your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Carrying case won't stay shut
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had any issues with the ratchet set, but the carrying case has a very flimsy clasp and keeps opening at bad times causing everything to fall out! Need to use a rubber band to keep it closed. I guess I can't complain given the price.
customer_reviews.author: Prime4Value

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Socket Set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set because I temporarily found myself without tools and I needed to work on my car. This set has everything I need and it's sturdy enough for some serious use. In addition, it's really compact. It's small enough to take along on any road trip, just in case you need a socket for emergency repairs. I'm not so enthusiastic that most of the sockets are sized for a 1/4" drive, although the ratchet is 3/8". However, the set includes an adapter and so far every socket has easily withstood everything I could throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Pieces are well made!
customer_reviews.text: I've used the set only once, to replace a car battery, but everything looks to be in order. I can't talk about durability, but this stuff is made in Taiwan so it's going to be better than anything made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Prosumer21

customer_reviews.title: Works well, is portable and will handle day to day jobs around the house.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used it to tighten a dinning room table that had wobbly legs. Worked like a charm. Super portable and handy to use. I can't speak to it's durability but seems like a pretty study set. I'll update my post if something breaks. But as it stands now I have it a 5 stars out of 5 for me. My cousin used it and is thinking of picking up a set too!
customer_reviews.author: Tino

customer_reviews.title: Good wrench set in a small package
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the build and the quality of this product. I just need some basic tools to fix some minor defects to my car and didn’t want to go all out buying a full set of wrenches. However these appear to be perfectly capable to tackle on most jobs that might arise in the future. The wrenches appear strong and don’t break under a lot of torque.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Calderone

customer_reviews.title: Great set! Great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ideal set for quick repairs. I keep it handy and it saves me the trouble of digging around in my big tool box. Used it to replace my auto battery. Good, sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: AC_Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Ratchet is meh
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a cheap set to just keep in my truck. Everything is decent except ratchet just sucks to use. Sockets feel loose on it, and low number of teeth just makes it feel crappy. Ended up buying a Pittsburgh pro 3/8 composite ratchet at harbor freight and keep that with this set instead. Works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: All parts came organized, quality is okay nothing special. About a month later and everything is working as it should, I only work on my car during the weekends so maybe heavy duty use will decrease durability or products life. Edit: about 3-4 months later most pieces rusted now and the box doesn't close or keep the sockets in their place. Yeah they still work but they're not cosmetically attractive anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando silva

customer_reviews.title: The DIYer's little helper!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known about this sooner when I was installing my TV wall mount. The 13mm lag bolts wasn't installing flush against the wall, and I had a drill with a bad battery and a stripped screw-head on top, so the only other option was to use a ratchet wrench on 'em. I just hope I don't need it again to take my TV off the wall, or fix something on Mom's truck in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S.

customer_reviews.title: it is fantastic for almost any type of home assembly from office ...
customer_reviews.text: Had no idea how much I needed this! Just about everything I bought needed these, or this made assembly 99% easier than without this set. I really really appreciate this tool set, it is fantastic for almost any type of home assembly from office chairs, to picnic tables, to gorilla carts, plant shelves, bathroom etageries, I've used it constantly and its helped so much, great to have.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Top Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Spring for the extra $7 or so for this  over “amazon basic” offering which is terrible
customer_reviews.text: The quality stood out before I even opened the case - yes, the case. Thick, tough plastic hinges and latch - which you just know on a cheap item will break - and then where will all those sockets go!...ratchet has a firm, strong feel to it with little wiggle (another tell tale sign). Finally, the chrome vinadium finish is really nice. Speaks quality. ...Now, I’m not saying these are in anywhere near the league of say Snap-on - but an excellent value IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t have high expectations, just wanted a set in the boat for hopefully occasional to never use. When I put the set in my tool bag the plastic case popped open spilling all the sockets down into my tool bag. Rather than wasting an hour rearranging and putting them back in their little spots, I just emptied the whole mess into the trash. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Steve STop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: The design of the box is weird
customer_reviews.text: This kit comes with a case, which carries all the sockets. This case however instead of having a flat top, it is shaped/formed to fit the sockets and wrenches. This makes it hard to open and close the box each time... you will have to put the items in its exact place (as it came) in order for it to close all the way(hassle!). I just put it all in a large bag. But It gave me what I needed (10mm). The sockets and tools themselves look nice, clean and high quality, but the case itself seems very cheaply made and not thought out.
customer_reviews.author: Greaves58

customer_reviews.title: nice set but
customer_reviews.text: I really like this set but for like 20 dollars more or so you can get 69 piece set with the extended sockets. It's a better deal. There made by the same company. Because when I was looking for the long sockets for them everybody else was selling them separately one side for metric and the other for Standard for about $20 apiece. So in the long run it was cheaper to go ahead and get the bigger kit. Very happy with them though so far.
customer_reviews.author: VC

customer_reviews.title: Get 18mm separately if you need one
customer_reviews.text: Great set. Feels and handles good. I went ahead and ordered a separate 18mm socket ($2.72 - Sunex 318m 3/8-Inch Drive 18-mm Impact Socket) as it is not included. That socket is pretty inexpensive, with good reviews and it's also impact grade. But I will have to find the space to put it in the socket wrench set box. :-(
customer_reviews.author: L Kom

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend Loves Them!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a present for my boyfriend who likes cars and bicycles. He loves it and has been showing it off. I do wish that the pieces would not go flying out of their spots if you opened it upside down, however that would mean it would need some sort of clipping system to keep them in and that would slow you down if you were trying to get things out of the box quicker, so I guess it just depends on what is important to you.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the assortment of sizes included in this set. I bought it to go in my rv so sizes mattered. Space is at a premium for tools in the rv so that was a criteria also. This doesn't take much space and has the sizes I wanted. They aren't the absolute best made tools I have ever had but should do the job I carry them for. Pretty sturdy though for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie P. Moses

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my 34 year old daughter/lawyer. She had the earlier one I gave her stolen. It looked good, and worked for what she needed. I only gave it 4 stars, because she will be the only one to ever use it. It will never be put through the paces by me. Looks good, worked, went over well as a replacement gift.
customer_reviews.author: kent dubose

customer_reviews.title: Truck tools
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the money. It's going in my truck. I was staying at a friend's hunting cabin a while back, in the middle of no where. We needed some tools to assemble a target. He didn't have much. I vowed that will never happen again.
customer_reviews.author: David Walter Andersen Jrn

customer_reviews.title: The case is a good fit for the tools and seems solid enough for ...
customer_reviews.text: The set was purchased as a gift for my son-in-law so I have not yet seen the tools in action. However, the sockets and drivers fit together well, the ratcheting mechanism seems solid, and there is a wide enough range of sockets to fit almost any job around the house or car. The case is a good fit for the tools and seems solid enough for useful life if treated well. We live on the ocean in Maine so I hope the steel will stand up to corrosion from our salty air but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Hurricane

customer_reviews.title: Needed these and the cost is excellent
customer_reviews.text: The case is not that great as it has a slight gap when closed so I would not trust it to be turned upside down, but I don't plan on doing that anyway. I needed the metric, as I had another tool set that had inches. I also love the screwdriver tool.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Very nice drive socket set!
customer_reviews.text: Boguht this for a DYI catalytic conveter replacement for my 1996 honda civic. Worked very well!!! It has both Metric/ English systems to suit all your needs! Great set for the price and good quality parts! I would highly reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: BayAreaBoss41510

customer_reviews.title: Box is Made of Cardboard
customer_reviews.text: Can't speak on the sockets. They are probably fine for basic home use. However the box they came in might as well be cardboard, how thin and flimsy it is. The sockets also do not snap in or even fit snug into their spots. The box also does not snap closed as tight as would make me feel safe. I nearly spilled all of the pieces everywhere upon opening for the first time. Closed it up instantly and returned. You could say you get what you pay for - but I found other options with sockets made of the same material in a much sturdier box for about the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool
customer_reviews.text: Got what I ordered. Have not used it, but it looks like a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Rockabilly

customer_reviews.title: Great tools!
customer_reviews.text: These are great!! They were cheap, but I bought them to work on my car and they’re serving me well. They don’t go as large as I want, but the only largeness missing is the very biggest one used for a car, so really good variety anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Socket set
customer_reviews.text: The set has plenty of options as far as sockets go. I like that the socket has a toggle switch to change between forward and backward. I have not used it yet, but it looks like a very nice socket set.
customer_reviews.author: Gail A. Lawlor

customer_reviews.title: Beginner tools for a lady
customer_reviews.text: First I must say I am a female first time buyer for this. For a beginner I believe I have bought something decent for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Tools for the go
customer_reviews.text: Just what you need to get the job done. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Nice socket set for home use.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Shipped quickly. The case is compact with each socket clearly labeled. Very versatile adapters are included to accommodate a wide range of applications. Much higher quality than I expected. I highly recommend this shop tool.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Wood

customer_reviews.title: Missing one important thing
customer_reviews.text: This came with ZERO in the way of instructions. With Google and Youtube I was able to figure it out, but even a basic visual guide of how to assemble the tools would have been helpful. Not everyone is experienced. Having said that, the pieces feel solid, and once I got the hang of it, I was able to get done what I needed with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Greenfeld

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used this set yet, but....
customer_reviews.text: it looks great! The only thing I would say is that the plastic case it comes in doesn't seem to latch or close very well at all, so I'm anxious to get this put somewhere it can lay flat and I don't have to be nervous that it's going to pop open any second.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over priced
customer_reviews.text: All of the items inside the case work but this product is over priced. It is worth $6-$10 dollars. My advice is to head to Harbor Freight instead.
customer_reviews.author: Prune Juice

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for travel and spares
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I don't have to go to the garage all the time from the back yard for sockets and a ratchet. Seems durable and on time. Also bought it as a travel set to take on road trips for just in case.
customer_reviews.author: cwaits

customer_reviews.title: Seems quite nice
customer_reviews.text: Seems quite nice so far. Well organized, and the black box containing the set is labeled, holds the sockets firmly, and well laid out. So far I'm impressed and the value is great. Will update later if I encounter problems.
customer_reviews.author: David L Mobley

customer_reviews.title: Pieces will get stuck
customer_reviews.text: The adapter for each socket gets stuck way too easily. If you don't have a pair of pliers, you will never be able to get the sockets off the adapter. I had to return my set. Buy each part that you need -- you don't need a whole set. The parts you have will be higher quality and better overall.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: recommend this
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 66 year old lady. I know nothing about tools but I found myself needing a socket. I ordered these and it worked for me. I like the case. Helps keeping it all together. I take the whole case with me so I can get the correct size. Saves walking. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Was taking apart my old garage door opener but realized I needed this. Also worked well with tv mounts. Exactly what I needed. Only thing I wish it came with was an attachment for a drill.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Craftmans twin brothers socket set
customer_reviews.text: This set is actually quite nice, the quality and durability so far has been great. Much nicer quality then what you’re able to get at places like harbor freight. Wouldn’t hesitate to try other products from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: JC Pinedo

customer_reviews.title: Basic socket set
customer_reviews.text: Some of my sockets disappeared so I needed a replacement. These are good ones at a reasonable price. Will they last a long time? No. Will they work well as long as they last? Yes. Thus the 4-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Larry H. Holt

customer_reviews.title: great fr the price
customer_reviews.text: if youre looking for a socket set to help you with light duty repairs every once and again this is a great set for you , i use it on the interior of my car and its perfect, I cant attest to using it on heavier duty things than that however, for the price i wouldn't suggest it.
customer_reviews.author: scooter nick

customer_reviews.title: Amazing assortment and quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Just got the delivery today so I can't rate for durability and sturdiness, but I give it a 5 for value. Looked at similar Craftsman product, but would have had to purchase the metric and sae sets costing a total of $49.98 to have a similar, but still fewer, number of sockets. Quality looks amazing for the price (less than $20.00).
customer_reviews.author: 4N6-PRO

customer_reviews.title: Small and Invaluable Tool
customer_reviews.text: I used the Ratchet Wrench to remove the old tuning machines from my guitar and to add the new ones. This is great when a box wrench or open-ended wrench will not do. It can be done, but both of those would mar the artful finish of the instrument should you slip. A case of using the tool for the job and this does that beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: H-Spike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: I had a particularly tough bit of wrenching to do (driving lag bolts into concrete) and I had broken two cheap socket wrenches on the first part of the project. I bought this one and it sailed through the second part of the project without a problem. I don't know if it would stand up as well as a high end socket wrench set over time, but you can't beat it for twenty bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Sweeting

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Loaned my first set to my dad....never got it back. lol So this is my second set. Good little set for the money. Use it often.I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: bnb

customer_reviews.title: very good for the money
customer_reviews.text: The tools are good and it has a lot of tools inside, I just return it because i find a Husky deal close to me and it was a little bit better for the same price. but definitely this one is good.
customer_reviews.author: Ana L.

customer_reviews.title: A well made set!
customer_reviews.text: Just got these in a few hours ago and already have used them for a few tasks around the house. Well made, easy to use, and they seem sturdy. Great set. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Goggins

customer_reviews.title: NOT 1/4" as Described
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a smaller, lightweight 1/4 socket set, this IS NOT it. This is heavy 3/8 set with a 1/4 adapter thrown in. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz Smith

customer_reviews.title: worth price
customer_reviews.text: All bits and pieces. works great. helped me change throttle body on car just yesterday. if tyou know your tools, this is one to get. Case makes it easy to carry around
customer_reviews.author: El Capitan

customer_reviews.title: I don't treat tools well, but....
customer_reviews.text: The first set I ever bought was a different manufacturer from Walmart, broke after first use. I saw the reviews and the price but still bought this product. Not a single piece has been broken or damaged so far, great value for money. I've even used this thing as a hammer in a pinch on a muffler during assembly without a single blemish.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Like the set, gave a 4 star rating simply because difficult to keep all the pieces in their respective slots. They fall out as soon as you close the case.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Sockets great case NOT
customer_reviews.text: I opened it to look at the sockets and couldn’t close it again. The clasp doesn’t work. Kind of useless if it doesn’t shut especially with all the little sockets. Not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Keone Liddell

customer_reviews.title: Ok tool, warped case
customer_reviews.text: The tools are ok, but the case to hold them is horrible. Upong delivery the case was warmed and does not close properly. The bits and tools fall out constantly which is annoying. Had to put everything is a platic lunch box to not lose bits.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Tool Set for Car Care
customer_reviews.text: I needed a complete tool set because I had to replace a car battery. This 40 piece EPAuto set saved the day. It handled my car needs perfectly. Great price and value.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought these years ago
customer_reviews.text: I've put off buying a ratchet set for years because I was under the impression that they were wildly expensive. These are amazing, well priced, and a must for every homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: Christine KurzTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: JUST WHAT I NEEDED
customer_reviews.text: I very much like this comprehensive small set of sockets that proved very useful to me in the replacement of her side mirror. It will make a nice addition to my growing cache of tools and I'm glad to have it it seems to be a solidly constructed set for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ron G Sr

customer_reviews.title: Socket Set with 72 Tooth Reversible Ratchet
customer_reviews.text: The plastic case is terrible. the pieces fall out. I have to secure the pieces with rubber bands! Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: MARC

customer_reviews.title: All good, bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: Wrench is fine, the case gives me anxiety because the first time I opened it everything fell out all over the floor. Can't beat the value, though.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Case is not good
customer_reviews.text: The tools themselves I guess you’re OK. The container that it comes in is nothing but crap. It doesn’t stay closed and they fall out all over
customer_reviews.author: EllieNae Designs

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to complain about. Great quality. Durable. The case is nice and compact. Great value especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: Marlu

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Nice tool set
customer_reviews.text: My real first set of tools, this is great for beginners or person that just bought a car or any other type of vehicle , whats included is pretty great to get most task done.
customer_reviews.author: XtremeGraphics

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy for the price. The only reason I gave it 4 stars, is due to the fact the handle on the ratchet was a little to short. As well as needed some bigger size sockets that did not come with this set.
customer_reviews.author: SJattan87

customer_reviews.title: Great for ATV repair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Grandson's birthday. He was thrilled, his mom not so much. He has taken his ATV partially apart. It's back together so I'm off the naughty list with my daughter. My grandson said every tool he needed to maintain his ATV was included in the kit and is very happy.
customer_reviews.author: witty knitty

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, particularly for the price. Case works great too. Very satisfied. Highly recommended compared to the other options we saw.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and surprisingly powerful
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about this based on the price... bought a kit like this at home depot and it broke the first time I used the ratchet! This however feels completely different, super sturdy and strong. I was able to repair my drivers side mirror with this in seconds and the bolts were super tight. Very organized and the case stays locked when closed.
customer_reviews.author: Knightwytt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Very useful set. I recomend it because has all combinationsof sizes. I use it every day in my job.
customer_reviews.author: German

customer_reviews.title: A good selection.
customer_reviews.text: I looked all around and this set had the most size selections for the money. They work well and I'm glad I went with it. If I changed anything, I'd ask for a little better case, as one tip can mix them up, but I'm sure a piece of tape across the top of them on each side would fix the problem. The outside of the case is nice and it's compact. Would choose to purchase this set again.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Stubbs

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice socket set to keep around the house or even in your car for emergencies or basic repairs. Only thing that the sockets won't stay in place. I solve that problem cutting a thin piece of foam sheet about a 1/8 of an inch thick. Besides that, it's a great set to keep around.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Ratchet is good rest isn't
customer_reviews.text: The actual ratchet is good quality but the sockets are sizes not commonly used to work on cars thought the sizes would be 7mm to 17mm and its sizes4.5 to 13 with alot of half sizes 4.5mm 5mm 5.5mm
customer_reviews.author: kassandra R.

customer_reviews.title: This is a comprehensive set of sockets that will handle most that 1/4 or 1/2 wrenches are used for.
customer_reviews.text: The units seem to be sturdy and well made. I just used them for one small task requiring metric sockets so I don't know how they will hold up in the long run or with heavy use. They were inexpensive and a good addition to my toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda D. Shapard

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: havent tried them yet but they appear well made and durable. case latch doesnt stay but velcro will easily fix it. great deal for all it includes
customer_reviews.author: bebopc7

customer_reviews.title: Great tool kit, Missing one socket on arrival
customer_reviews.text: The tool set is nice and works well. Mine arrived wrapped in plastic which i assume is usual but upon opening i was missing a socket. I needed to use the tools immediately upon receiving so I didn’t raise any concerns with the vendor. Leaving this comment because the mistake had to have been on the assembly/production side of the purchase given the plastic wrapping and everything was in tact. Tool kit works great, just missing a socket.
customer_reviews.author: kyle bradfowski

customer_reviews.title: Versatile set for multiple uses at home
customer_reviews.text: Handy inexpensive set for home use. Well made and sturdy. Excellent value and versatile. One socket size will fit my oil drain plug and another will fit a 5x5 dog kennel I want to disassemble. Much better than messing with an adjustable wrench.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fralick

customer_reviews.title: Very Cost efficient and sturdy item
customer_reviews.text: Very cost efficient and sturdy item! Fast service and would definitely purchase from seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K. Gin

customer_reviews.title: A nice set at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional so can't attest to how this holds up to heavy use, but seemed a perfect match for my random needs. Disassembled a bed frame quickly and easily, and I'm a know nothing.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Beginner set
customer_reviews.text: 40 pieces but did not have the one size I needed. It perfect for starter with simple at home need but not mechanic ready.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Hansy

customer_reviews.title: Good starter or car set
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's a good deal. It seems fairly durable, and works well. It's not the best quality, but it's pretty much just for my car and doesnt need to be. So if you just want some tools to get a start on having some, or want something for your car in case you need them on the road, this would be a good set to get.
customer_reviews.author: Musicman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for around the house. My son used it to fix his alternator on his car. He had to buy a socket of course but it worked successfully no problems. It is perfect for our needs
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Hancock

customer_reviews.title: 🥈👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to keep in the truck. Hate having to road trip pack with shop/garage tools. That being said, surprised on quality and versatility. Not saying it’s an every day kit, but super nice for the weekend warriors.
customer_reviews.author: BookWorm

product_meta.title: 40 Pieces - EPAuto 1/4-Inch & 3/8-Inch Drive Socket Set with 72 Tooth Reversible Ratchet
feature_bullets: Durability: Made from Hardened treated Chrome Vanadium steel alloy (Cr-V)
Easy Storage: A sturdy plastic organizing case is included.
Both Metric and English sizes are included. 3/8” Reversible 72 Teeth Ratchet is included.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,146 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
